reviews.review_msg: I don't really understand the materials he teach. But he is very patient and easy approach. Easy class.

This course is pretty difficult, the textbook is terrible. Even though the pro is less organized and dry, but his notes is helpful and all the exams are open-book. Do use the workshop and TAs there are wonderful. The pro. gave all the key points before exam, and answer questions through class caucus quite in time.
This guy is unorganized and dry

No dates on Syllabus. Doesn't respond to E-Mails. Came to class after missing a class and suddenly we had a quiz. Doesn't know how to teach. Spends the whole lecture jumping from topic to topic. I'm dropping his class and I have learned absolutely nothing aside from what I taught myself outside of class.
The worst prof ever. Seriously, my advice to anyone who wants to take Stat100, avoid him.  Not joking

He's a nice guy but does a terrible job at communicating the material to the class. Hard to understand what he's saying because of his accent. Also he asks bonus questions on exams about random things he's mentioned in class. Might as well learn from the lecture notestextbook by yourself because there was really no point in attending class.
Would try to stay for the whole lecture, always ended up leaving. Just so hard to understand what he was talking about that it was easier to teach myself from the textbook.

The lectures are so long and dull. Jorge always over explains in a convoluted manner, and goes off on long tangents about unrelated stuff outside of the scope of the course. For example, we were learning slope, essentially a basic math concept that should be easy to follow. He explained it in such a diluted way that no one understood what he said.
Lectures are so dull, but don't think you can get away with passing just by reading the text book. Final was not comparable to anything covered in class. He also wears really tacky sweaters

This prof is horrible. He can't speak English worth a damn, he does not come prepared for class, he gives credit questions on exam about him. Like "in this lecture Jorge said..."... I can't even understand him cause he cannot speak English and he is giving questions like that?
Don't take any class with him !!!! Useless lecture. Exam is difficult. Strong accent!  Making 100 level class more difficult and confused!

I attended his lectures at first but he doesn't make sense, his accent makes things unclear, and I usually end up leaving more confused than ever. He posts his notes (unclear as they are) online and the textbook makes things make sense so I'm never sitting through one of those lectures again. The material itself is relatively simple.

Hard to understand. Lectures feel like they go on forever. The only incentive to go to lecture is he puts bonus questions on exams about stuff he does in class. Lectures notes are pretty much straight from the textbook. That said, if you read the textbook and understand the concepts, it's the easiest class I've ever taken.

This person cannot even speak English and teaching statistics in university. In class people leave in the middle of class while he is talking, no one cares what he says and even when he ask silence no one does. He should not be teaching at all. He used MS paint to teach stats... He does not know what he is doing at all. Do not take this class.

It should be a very easy course exclude the situation that you choose Jorge's STAT100!!!!!!!! He is really boring and prefers to give "surprising" bonus questions on all exams. This question may be "what unusual thing Jorge did in class?" Lecture notes are not helpful at all, if your GPA is really high,you can try this one>_<

Useless lectures where he just reads off book. Very unclear, slow, and boring, but lots of bonus qs on tests about things he does or says in class. Easy course but he has the ability to make it hard. Super low averages on exams

One of the worst guy who has no talents of teaching at all. The lectures were unacceptably disorganized. So just read the text. There were no need to attend his meaningless lectures unless you want earn some bonus marks at exams. He seems nice guy, but not a great teacher.

I really hate him!!!He has accent and its really hard to understand! What's more, he make strange question such as "What is the data from example in the text!". And the average is around 60% every midterm!
nice teacher, easy course

Took this class thinking it'll be a GPA booster. I was wrong. Louis' lectures are pulled straight out of the textbook, and we are expected to know the material before we show up. His iClicker quizzes are nothing compared to the exams. Only good thing is that he sends emails often & allows a cheatsheet into the exams. I don't recommend him at all!.

I felt bad for the guy in the beginning because no one respected him, but I don't feel bad anymore. Louis is just a (bad word) teacher and no one can understand a word he says. He is the worst prof I've ever had at SFU and I'm genuinely surprised that anyone would rate him a 5. The textbook was also trash and didn't care enough to get spell check.
Honestly had to teach myself all the materials for this class. Originally had a good time because the midterms were okay but the final said "I'mma end this man's whole career".
Has no idea how to teach, barely knows how to speak English. Would never have him again, only good perk is that he sent emails daily regarding questions asked by other students.

In all fairness, Louis seems like a nice guy. HOWEVER, he is the absolute worst prof I've had in my life. All of your learning is done out of the textbook as the whole lectures are quizzes. His exams are also nothing like the quizzes and he does an awful job telling you what you need to know for the exams. Avoid Louis at all costs.

I feel bad for the guy because no one takes him seriously but that doesn't make up for the fact thats he isn't a very good prof. On the first day of class he tells you he wont be teaching but will expect you to teach yourselves. There are quizzes every class that are worth marks, so don't skip a day!

As another reviewer said: ignore all the sarcastic comments below. Here is a completely honest rating: Professor Louis is a solid choice. His accent may be hard to understand, but the notes are straight forward, the tests are extremely simple (you also get a double sided cheat sheet for it) & easy iclicker marks. Overall, he is genuinely a good guy

Everybody here calling this prof "the best prof at sfu" is trolling. They are being sarcastic due to the fact that professor Ng is a mediocre professor at best. I honestly feel bad for him since people don't take his class seriously, as they talk & stay on their computers the whole class. Very nice guy though, he responds to emails really fast.
gives you a cheat sheet for the midterm

can barely speak english, does not even teach the class, he expects you to learn everything before class and you are supposed to show up with full understanding and then he gives iclicker quizzes, have no idea what to expect on midterm and final
He is the worst prof I've ever had in my 3 years of SFU. His accent is impossible to understand and his in-class quizzes make no sense. This is supposed to be an easy class but he makes it impossible
He is the best and he teach me how to use an iclickerwhat a wonderful teacher
I can't live without attending his lecture every week!

Hilarious guy, New and seasonal prof. His first quizzes were weird, but it looks like he is managing it after the department helped out. Feel bad as he is trying to figure out the tech used in SFU but overall nice guy. You can see that he tries his best. Good guy
We enjoyed browsing social media in class.
He is the best professor I have ever seen
Amazing!
Hebis very good at stat!
Hilarious prof!
He is very famous in Hong Kong and I want to meet him for a long time already! A fabulous choice for stat major students
Amazing lecture! I can now have good knowledge on Iclicker!

You can never grow up until you meet this man. You learn not only course materials from his lectures, but also the philosophy of life. This course completely changed my logical world and led me to reflect everything in the real world. DO NOT MISS THE BEST PROFESSOR IN SFU!!
He is the best, he gives you quiz every lecture. And he is handsome3
Louis is awesome, not just because he is handsome! He will also send you tons of emails to spam you mail box! I love him! I dont know why people are hating at him.
best in sfu
Respectful teacher!
I LOVE HIMMMM! HE IS SOOO HANDSOM !!!!
He is the best professor in the world.

Louis is the worst professor I have ever had at SFU. He doesn't teach course content, so you have to read the textbook or you wont understand the quizzes that occur every lecture. He often seems confused with technology. His questions are vague and during the semester the stat department had to get involved... Stay away from this professor.
He is perfect
he can make the easiest course to be the hardest course,that's awesome!
Good
A professor who cares the student a lot! Definitely recommend him!
Louis Ng is the hero in math 100!
Awesome pro!
Louis is an amazing prof in SFU!!! He can let you learn nothing on STAT:) Oh btw his quizzes can save you bucks for an IQ Test outside:))))))))
Best professor ever had! I don't know why someone is complaining about him!

Teach absolutely nothing. Quiz everyday about non-statistic problem. Need to study by urself. Textbook needed since he teach nothing. Also this guy start his first lecture by saying"it is your responsibility to study by yourself" "this course is for the people who dont want to study statistic" I cannot find any prof is worse than him in SFU.

U can never able to understand what he is teaching. He is testing you social things more than statistics. I don't know how to prepare my exams as his questions are too random to answer. His is BAAAAAAAD. The class is stupid.
Love Louis a lot! He is a fabulous professor!
Best Stat 100 Professor in SFU. Definitely recommend him!
So bad teacher!

Best professor ever!! youtube is the most significant teaching material for himteach nothing related to statistics but tell you that cocaine is illegal, price of gas affect proportion of people driving and kids from 1-9 cannot read or write.

Wow. He started off the class by saying, "This class requires you to learn on your own." iClicker quizzes are based on hypothetical common sense rather than applying terminologies. Spends the whole class trying to get through the quizzes and barely goes over the material... Hard to understand as well.

I took STAT 100 in the Spring 2013 semester and had Wendell. I thought he was great. Occasionally, his lectures may be a bit dry; however, he is willing to clear up any issues and really tries to make the material interesting. That being said, he is a good guy - the material is dull. He will answer ALL of your questions and provides extra help.
The easiness rating for him should be lower. Chaotic and dull lectures. Definitely not the prof you would want take stat with.

Take his class ONLY if you are willing to teach yourself from the text, and spent countless hours on assignments.                                              Irresponsible, not helpful, boring lecture that does nothing but damaging your ear-drum. Makes a breath class tougher than it is designed to be.

Avoid this guy if you don't want to come to lecture only for the purpose of damaging your ear-drum. Irresponsible, not helpful, make a breath class tougher than it meant to be. Take his class ONLY if you are willing to teach yourself from the text, and spent countless hours on assignments.

Although he can be a bit dry at times, he really is a good prof. He has a high level of interest in his materials, and goes over a lot to make sure you understand. I wouldn't say class is mandatory to go to, but read the textbook. Easy exams, combined worth 80% of your mark. Solid Q credit.
Pretty easy course. He isn't the best prof but he definitely tries. Just read the book and you should be fine. Final exam took questions from a sample final he gave us, and from assignments.
Horrible, avoid this guy.

He's a new prof, only in his second semester of teaching, so I won't be too harsh on him, but he definitely lacks experience. I don't like how his lecture slides are only half filled, and you have to attend class to copy the other half. Stat 100 was an easy class overall, if you study, easy high mark.

He is fine to me, but some questions on midterms are pretty tricky, and like someone said, he is pretty unclear in lecture. and he skips slides quickly that we have no time to copy. hopefully final wont be too hard

He is pretty unorganized and I didn't get most of his ideas half of the time. I am so glad that the semester is almost done. His insistence on using the JMP program is unreasonable as it is not at all easy to use. He is a sessional for this course, but the class was no fun.
Makes constant mistakes during lectures and exams. But if a student makes a mistake then he'll make sure to lower marks. Hard class to pass!
not helpful at all, he does not make himself clear all the time. avoid him

This man is so entertaining, genuinely made coming to class a memorable thing. His TA's this semester also seem to be very down to earth and I appreciate that he makes little worksheets that aren't overwhelming. There is lots of new vocabulary for this class that you need to learn, but his office hours are very helpful and accessible.

such an amazing prof, he was always very helpful. his lectures were well-organised and structured perfectly for the course. his exams were a good format, and were reasonable in terms of content per test. he was quick to respond to emails and gave great feedback and help when asked. love him, would recommend him to anyone looking for this credit!

Tom is an angel! Lectures (for those who actually attend) were engaging and you can tell how passionate he is about what he is teaching. If you do not like math, but need a B-Sci credit, take this with Tom!!! 2 midterms, 1 final, all open book/note. Small assignments for each unit. Marks came back very efficiently. 10/10 would recommend this dude!

She has no respect in the classroom because she's very soft-spoken.  Lecture notes are great and follow the textbook very closely.  Super easy subject matter.  She explained everything very clearly but people were too busy talking/showing up 45 minutes late to pay attention.  Sit in the front.

I like her, but absolutely hated the student body that was present. She's rather soft-spoken, so it was difficult to hear when students talked - which then encouraged her to stop lecture, which led to more disruptions, sadly. She means well, but students really lack respect. Homework is lengthy, but relates to exams. Pretty straightforward overall.
she's really nice, just not very good at teaching. read the book and you'll be fine bc its all open note

Poor teaching style, gets off topic and often gets confused with her own thoughts. She's a good person, she just isn't good at teaching this class. Luckily the material is easy to understand without her help.
She is very stubborn, when you're late for class she stops the entire lecture just to call out on that particular student and asks them to leave the class. Like dude this aint high school.

She stops her lectures every time a student is late or using their phone and says "you are disrupting the class". Does she not understand that taking time out of her lecture to call every student out is more disruptive and wastes more time? She has a very bad attitude and no respect for her students. I advise that you stay away from her.
She's pretty bad

Lecture notes  are unorganized i.e. do not have page numbers. Pre-quizzes are only opened for a short period of time. She is the only prof available in this semester.  Fortunately, the material from the textbook is relatively easy.
the best teacher i ever met

She is too worried about the use of phones, and people murmuring in her class. In a class of 500 students, it is extremely unlikely for it to be completely silent. She should get over herself. Not a good lecturer. Students will be lucky that the material is easy to learn through the textbook.

Derek is a good prof who actually cares about students. The exams were pretty straightforward and manageable. The quizzes were a bit more difficult than the final exams, but if you do all the suggested problems you'll do well.

Derek was such a great prof, his lectures were entertaining and informative. You will need the textbook to go more in depth for a few things, but overall great prof. The class was made up of a couple quizzes and a final (which was so easy).

Derek jumps all over the place during his lectures. Concepts are super easy to understand, but quiz wording is really confusing; intentionally worded to throw you off. The final exam is relatively easy though.

I hate stats but Derek was a really good prof in how he taught the course. He was clear in what he expected. The only bad thing I can say is that there were a few typos in his notes, other than that he was quite a solid choice. 4 quizzes and 1 final exam. The quizzes were around average in terms of difficulty but the final was honestly a breeze.
I highly recommend this prof if you are not necessarily strong in math. He explains concepts well and creates tests fairly.
The class was made up of 4 exams and one final. Exams were extremely fair. Derek is a very nice prof, would highly recommend him.
He's a real gem. I love him!!!

Funny guy, lectures and power point were recorded and posted. For a boring class he made it a bit interesting, I took it cause I had too for graduation, and it was not as bad as I thought it would be. I do not like math concepts so that is really saying something.

Derek is possibly the best professor at SFU; he knows his stuff and DOES deliver it very well. His assignments are not too bad, and his exams are VERY fair. If you know enough math to solve an equation, and you do your work, this course is a piece of cake... and if math isn't your strength, you can still do great if you attend lecture! 10/10
One of the best profs at SFU, I highly recommend taking a class with him. Easy assignments due every week, midterms and final are based on questions similar to his examples.
best prof in sfu by far. Go to class, do your suggested problems and the assignments. Easily get an A.

Most of the questions on his midterms and the final are based on examples from his lectures, and text book. If you do questions from the text you should be fine. Clarification is encouraged, and he is straight forward. Slides are found online, but have blank spaces for you to fill out, which you need to attend lecture for.

He is a very nice guy! This course is mostly based on the examples in the textbook, and some of his lecture slides. Got C on the first mt and C+ for the second one, however the final was easier than expected, and ended up with a B- in the course, and I am very satisfied with it. I would recommend this course for people who are interested in math:).

Need a B-Sci course? TAKE THIS CLASS! Derek is a fantastic prof who ensures that he teaches each topic with clarity. He explains everything so well in lecture and office hours that there shouldn't be anything you don't understand. He is very organized as well. There are weekly assignments that are quite manageable. not curved but you wont need it

Very clear and organized notes and lectures. Textbook is rarely helpful, I only used it for the assignment questions. Overall the assignments, exams, and class were very easy, and everything came naturally to me. However, my friend who was struggling found his lectures helpful. The professor is easy and knows how to teach.

Prof is great. TA Doesn't know English & can't accept anything on the midterm unless it's word for word same as the sample answer. When your answer literally means the same thing, she tries to distort your logic and claims that your answer can be misinterpret as something else. Keeps leaning on desk and play candy crush on her iPad in the workshop.
wow. assignments are relatively easy. the midterm isnt exactly hard but they mark it so hard. barely passed. do not recommend this class.

I adore him! He is an amazing prof with a great sense of humour. His lectures are super clear and he makes everything easy to understand. He has surprisingly made stats my favourite class this semester! Totally recommend taking this class with him.
Bing is the man! Loved taking this course with him. Would definetely take another course with him in the future
One of the best prof's I've ever had! He makes stats enjoyable and has such a great personality.
He's really a nice and helpful professor!!!truly recommend!!

Derek made the course fairly easy and straightforward. His exams are very fair as it's based mostly on problems seen before. Lectures are very informative for the exams and he tries his best to make them as entertaining as possible. There wasn't too much work involved in the course. All in all, a very great and fair prof.

One of the best profs! Makes me want to take more statistic courses even though I was never interested. Test and exams are fair and if you went to class, you will do super great, if not, you will do fairly well too. Overall, he is just a very nice guy and very patient with students who are a bit slow.
Amazing prof, easy tests, good speaker, easy material, nice and humorous guy.  I got an A.  TAKE STAT 100 WITH THIS MAN

One of the best prof. at SFU.  Tells you exactly what he needs from the students.  Lectures are well explained and lots of funny jokes.  And, he is a very nice person.  If you attend lectures and follow what he repeats in class, you will do well.
Explains concept clearly. Assignments worth way too little considering for the efforts needed. Exams are not easy.
Very good prof - explained all concepts clearly and made a math class engaging with a mixture of real life examples, humour, and good looks. Highly recommend this class

I really appreciated how he ran his lectures and how he was accessible at all times and encouraged questions. Great class for a Q requirement. Just attend class, do the suggested questions and assignments and you'll do fine.
Derek is nice and helpful. His lectures are easy to understand. Exams and assignment are fair as well. Definitely a good course to take for Q-credit!!!
Best prof ever!
No Comments
Im not sure how she is a professor. Never made sense what was going on during class.

Gaitri uses embedded questions in her lecture videos that don't work half of the time when you submit them, but continues to use this method despite many students having issues with it for the entire semester and many complaints. Tells students to complete assignments over 24h ahead of the due date to "prevent this issue". Lectures are dry + boring
stat100 is more difficult than Nima 300 level. Paya teaches like excrement, but the problem is extremely hard!!!!

The worst teacher I have ever met in the years of SFU. Lots of stuff keep you busy, and I believe 4xx courses might have the same level of heaviness as this course do. Her lecture just read powerpoints and sometime even let students read by themselves. Make A LOT OF MISTAKES when grading, you have to come to her office hour becuase she will never e

Honestly not the best prof. I didn't mind the class because of my previous history with the material but for anyone who is new to math/statistics, this was definitely brutal. It's all self-taught and very assignment heavy. Two chapters and one assignment minimum per week. Overall, a lot. Aside from being a sweet lady, Gaitri wasn't really helpful.

Yet another online class that I had to teach to myself. Pretty useless lectures, but Gaitri is the only prof I had this semester that would respond to emails within 3 hours and always asked how school was going for me. She is a very nice lady, but I shouldn't need to pay tuition for nice emails from my professor.

Avoid at all costs !!! Her final was awfully created and didnt touch on 90% of the material taught (self taught) cause she doesnt teach anything... also announced she wont have final grades till mid January which is insanely inconvenient for the students who need to submit final grades to departments or sponsors ... overall such an awful prof

She failed to upload a huge section of the exam containing all the easier content from chapters 1-6, didn't help me access it and is now weighing my scores on the other 2 thirds of the exam more so which were the more complicated word problems with more chances to lose marks.

Makes you watch lots of videos to continue in the course. Proceeds not to actually teach anything though. You literally have to teach and learn everything yourself to do well, luckily the material isnt that hard for the most part. If you can take with any other prof Id recommend them over her any day. Her final was a mess too
worst teacher in SFU. many things except study need to do. complicated format of homework. If you just make mistake in format, you will get zero.

If you are not willing to teach everything to yourself, do not take a class with this prof. Prof is too lazy and does not do a good job of going in-depth for any of the concepts. The slides are basically just a repeat of the textbook with basic examples but the work uses advanced examples that just end up confusing the student.

The biggest mess of a class in my university career. Very vague lectures so you need to teach yourself with the textbook. She can never be reached and even during office hours there are too many confused students asking questions to ask yours. Our final was 3 websites we needed to switch between which was filled with errors and issues. Please avoid

Asgments, quizzes, and final were not too challenging. Just read the notes, do txtbk examples and watch the lectures, material is not hard. Once we had a problem with a webwork quiz, but she extended the time so it was no big deal. I notice a lot of students already had a bad impression of her, probably due to the reviews. She's really not that bad

A bit disorganized. Make sure you are following the announcements section on Canvas to keep up with things. Her lectures are decent, and she seems nice enough. If you have a good math background, than it should not be a very challenging course. If not, than you may need to do more textbook questions and make sure you attend/watch all the lectures.

Gaitri is very kind and makes STAT100 an easy course. Helped me with a problem with an assignment early in the semester and was very accessible for that. Not the best lecturer, but she makes up for it (to me) by being approachable and having easy quizzes/exams/assignments.

Oh boy. Stats 100 isn't a hard class, however be ready to do EVERYTHING on your own. AWFUL lecturer. EASY CLASS. I'd be scared to take any hard class with her. Doesn't have a great grasp on how technology works. Doesn't answer questions well or respond to emails. She can be fairly reasonable and nice though.

Hands down the worst prof I have ever had. You can tell she was not meant to teach as her methods of explaining and presenting information are insufferable at best. She doesn't teach you, you teach yourself, if not you fail. Please, if you have any respect for yourself DO NOT take her for any course. I should have just listened to the reviews...

Decent prof, lots of hate online. Concepts of the course is VERY straightforward, allows you to have a cheat-sheet during exams. Sure, her lectures are dry, but you can easily learn everything from the textbook, so you don't need to attend lectures. Overall, if you have a half decent foundation in math, honestly, this course is a B+. (CS MAJOR)

Makes material more confusing than it should be Assignments long, redundant, time-consuming Grades can never be seen on Canvas ("Calculation of totals has been disabled") Usage of 3 systems (Crowdmark, WeBWork, Canvas) makes viewing everything confusing and disorganized Formatting of Canvas is messy Lectures are boring, iClicker marks

Although she seems like a nice person, her lectures were extremely dry and were impossible to sit through. In addition to this, she failed to post any updates on canvas or send out emails regarding the changes in grade distribution or additional assignments when we moved online due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Takes the easiest possible path for herself, doesn't care about her students. Extremely inefficient and indecisive.

I know there are lots of review saying shes bad, but actually her lecture is decent and understandable, she is an amazing person. Ive never met a kinder professor than her, she is always approachable, kind and friendly. She is very caring, really wants to help her students. She also often ask how she could improve her teaching or the lecture.

Gaitri Yapa is absolutely brutal. All the homework and exam questions are very poor questions and struggle to actually evaluate the concept its more common sense. For example there were questions about how zip codes work when were in Canada. Her lectures are terribly organized and her lecturing skills are painful to witness, totally monotone , slow

I found Professor Yapa to be helpful. My knowledge in university level STAT/Math is rudimentary and I took this course to fulfill quantitative requirement. Professor Yapa provided many opportunities in class and through online quizzes and assignments to learn the course content. It was evident that she cared about students success.

I stopped going to class halfway through, the lectures were unbearable. Very slow and answers too many questions during class. I ended up just reading the textbook and getting an A. iClicker questions during class for credit. She has an accent and she spends a considerable amount of time trying to silence the class.

Shes honestly a bad teacher, but the class was very easy and you should be able to walk out with a B. She allows you to bring cheat sheets to the quizzes and the final exam. The material is quite easy and mostly common sense and very minimal math. Only go to her lectures if you want the iClicker marks.
Avoid at all costs. Nothing more needs to be said.

By far the WORST experience I have ever had with a class and a professor at SFU. She is disrespectful, does not know what she's talking about, and is unwilling to take questions or criticism from students. Her tests vary wildly in difficulty and she is incredibly disorganized. Do NOT take this class under any circumstances, find something else!

Her class is the most terrible class I have taken in SFU. There is no need to go to class unless you want your icliker participation mark. Her accent always makes me feel confused and her in-class activity is meaningless. The course is not difficult, but her teaching is terrible. Highly not recommend!!!!!!
I wish she knew how to speak English. As another person wrote here, subtitles would drastically improve this class to a point it would make it somewhat worth showing up to it.
Enjoy paying 800 bucks to teach yourself an entire stat course. Do not recommend taking Guy Three.
Poor lecture!!! Do not take the course of this prof!! The course is easy, but it is useless to attend for class You can learn it by yourself at home
No one understands a word she's saying, subtitles would be helpful

if possible 0/5... one of the worst profs i've had. Super disorganized. Skipped required concepts and skimmed lecture slides & TAs mark exams and assignments you dont know what is required (incoherent). Not available outside or in class.. doesn't answer questions and email. Random iClicker questions not related to course.
BAD
She is the worst instructor I've ever had. She didn't explain anything and her lecture is so messy. Iclickers questions are terrible and not useful at all.

Content could be understood with a good teacher but we are quizzed the entire class every class with iclickers before learning anything. Second midterm did not relate to anything we taught ourselves from the book...

avoid taking this prof if you can!! hard to understand him because of his thick accent and he doesnt even teach. tells us he likes to use this reverse classroom method which is just a load of bs, he actually means he doesnt want to teach so you can teach yourself. i-clicker quiz at ever lecture on each chapter that you have to teach yourself.
Doesnt teach a thing at all. Spend the whole class doing iclicker quiz

This course is 90% exam based with a bunch of HW! Exams are open book but are quite tricky with a pop question at the end that you can only solve if you attend lectures. Personally I hated it, but it's over.
Honestly, didn't care bout this class much but exams were a joke. Forget about the fact that they're open book since that ain't gonna help ya.

Prof Loughin was a joy to have as a prof. He genuinely cares about his students, and he really has a passion for what he teaches. Two midterms and a final, all of which were fair.  Often he would reflect on his tests and make adjustments where he felt the questions were too confusing. Amazing prof, funny, and wishes the best for his students.
dont bother taking this class as an elective lol

the best thing is the exams are open-book, so dont waste thing to make notes(just bring the book to exam, but make sure you know where to find info. you needed in exam.) I found the prof is trying to make the lecture interesting, but i cant enjoy it. However, better to go to lecture for bonous point questions in exams.

This prof is the most nicest prof I have even seen at SFU. His course is pretty engaging, fun, and not hard. He is alway ready to help students and he has really generous and kind personality. Go with this prof. You will not regret. :)
No Comments
No Comments

"ITs an EaSy GpA bOOstEr" I took stat100 with him thinking it'd be a breeze in the park but oh boy was I wrong. Gamage as a prof is actually great, he listens and can be funny at times. This class had 1 of 2 assessments. Quizzes and exams. His quizzes were not bad but his exams were insanely hard. I'd look elsewhere first if I were you.

A good professor with a fair and consistent difficulty for exams. You know what to expect for the exams and he makes the course concepts relevant and reasonable. His exams are very fair and comprehensive.

Gamage is a caring and attentive prof. He always made sure the concepts were understood. It may have felt boring and repetitive since it was an easy intro class, but it was very helpful towards the end when the material became more complex. It was hard not skipping lectures, but there were top hat quizzes almost every lecture. Overall great prof.

Fun and Easy STATS class, most questions come dierctly from textbook, suggest using the text as it helps for exams and quizzes. Participation in Class matters as tophat quizzes are straightforward and worth 10% of mark. Very fun prof, easy class if you pay attention and do practice questions!

his notes and lectures are very scattered, self taught a lot of material. he spends time on things that are easy and skims over the hard stuff. his marking and homework is fairly easy just sucks because i taught all the hard stuff. also he's is hard to understand due to his accent

He's a great professor. He takes genuine care into a student's learning; always reassuring, checking, and engaging with the students to make sure we understand. His work load is reasonable, manageable, relevant and super helpful! A nice guy with some humor here and there. Would recommendd
I didn't even show up to class ever and got a B, easy ass class with a funny dude.

Good prof but you couldn't understand most of whatever he was talking about during lecture; heavy accent. Class is super easy, textbook is good for supplementary material but super good GPA booster. Everything is straight forward, exams are based off of lecture slides and questions follow the assignment question. Allows cheat sheet for final

Probably one of my best GPA booster course. Content is really easy and interesting. His accent might be a little hard to understand but he clearly explains everything on his lecture slides. It's useful to go to his office hour if you have any question about the assignments. Overall, he is a very caring prof. Highly recommend!
Dude is so chill

Harsha is an amazing prof. He is very specific with his grading criteria. The midterms were very fair and you are told what is expected from you. He allowed a cheat sheet for the final exam, so you don't need to memorize the formulas. He goes through a lot of examples during lecture that help with the 5 assignments and he gives hints for exams.

Really kind and caring stat teacher. Managed very well for a class that a lot of non mathematically inclined students take. He teaches clearly and is always ready to help his students. Great guy, highly recommend.
Harsha is an amazing prof who cares about his students and his course content. He makes an effort to make some of the dry material interesting and is overall a really nice guy.

Harsha is one of the best profs I've ever had. He makes lectures as entertaining as possible cracking jokes now and then. Very passionate about stats and he cares about the students. Despite the difficult class setting, he did an amazing job at teaching. Couldn't recommend him more.

Harsha is by far one of the best profs I've ever had! Midterms and final are straightforward as long as you do practice questions out of the textbook. His teaching style is amazing and he's kind of funny as well. Highly recommend taking Stats 100 with him!!

He an amazing prof! He has the lecture slides available on Canvas before lecture and it has all the key points. The tests are fair and most of the questions are the practice questions from the textbook. He also responds to email very quickly. He's very nice and knows his stuff. I highly recommend taking a class with him!
Easy prof! Take stat100 with him, you won't regret. Just take some time to read his slides than you  will be fine.

His lectures were easy to follow, and there were no surprises on the midterms or final exam. If you take some time to study, you will do well in his class. He's also just a good guy who has an interesting educational background.

To all arts students who are dreading to take stats, PLEASE TAKE IT WITH HARSHA! He makes it very easy to understand concepts, his assignments are rather easy, and the three exams are very fair. The only downside I would say is 5 assignments and 2 midterms in between can seem never ending. I'd also consider taking STAT203 w/ him in the future!
One of the best profs at SFU! His lectures are very easy to follow and he's a funny guy. Just 5 easy assignments, 2 midterms, and 1 final.
He is very helpful and fair. Just read the slides for the midterms and final, and u will be fine!

Even though the concept was dry af, Harsh made it somewhat enjoyable. He is super helpful and approachable during his office hour. His exams are relatively easy. 100% recommend!!! be ready for his cricket love( he shows his cricket video during lecture)

Harsha is a good teacher. he is clear in what he expects and does a good job in explaining concepts in the simplest way possible. He is very helpful and avaliable when needed. He also  listens to students regarding  ( he even accepted a one page cheat sheet on the final)
Sonja is a babe. She gives great concise lectures that are relevant to examinations. She is fun but not too goofy. Just do readings and possibly attend lectures. Mandatory lab quizzes.

Had very clear lecture slides and was fairly accessible outside of class via Canvas discussions. She was very transparent of the solutions that made it easy to follow. It was my second time getting around this class and she made it much easier to understand. I didnt like how the midterms were only out of 17 so each mark would drop your percentage

Sonja is an amazing prof. she teaches the material so clearly and she knows the areas where students can find difficult. She is very accessible outside of class. Her tests were fair and she made the content easier than it was. I highly suggest taking this class with her if you want a gpa booster.

Sonja explains concepts thoroughly and her lectures are easy to follow. She also records all lectures and posts annotated slides which is useful for review. Review lecture notes, assignments, labs, and read chapters that are more complex, and you'll really enjoy this course! Truly everything you could ask for in a prof

Sonja is superb. By far one of the best professors I've encountered in all my post-secondary experience. For reference, I am NOT a "math person" yet, received an A-. Yes, it's fairly easy so long as you just keep up & attend labs (heavily referenced on exams). Well-paced & very clear, Sonja personally takes a lot of care to encourage your success.

Everything you want in a professor! She records lectures, posts annotated slides, and tells you the topics that will be on the exam. Her lectures follow closely with the textbook. You get a cheatsheet for all the exams, I got 100% on both midterms so far! You also learn A LOT in this class and the material is super interesting.

Great prof! Highly recommend if you're a bus student and wanna get a science cred + learn some basics before bus 232. Exams are super easy - you get a cheat sheet. I literally just study the night before by listening to her lectures in 2x speed and writing up a cheat sheet. Literally highschool stats with the first exam being mean median and mode.

Sonja is an amazing prof -- she's super caring for her students, explains concepts thoroughly, lectures are easy to follow. Tests are relatively easy, based on materials pulled directly from lectures and labs. Attend all lectures and labs, review lecture notes, and read chapters that are more complex, and you'll breeze through this course!

STAT100 was one of the easiest classes I've ever taken. There were bi-weekly assignments which were like 2-5 questions, and they were based directly on the lectures (i.e., the questions were ones Sonja went over in lecture or ones covered in the labs by the TAs). The exams were also so fair. You get a cheat sheet (1 page) and there's no surprises.
Sonja is great at explaining entry-level concepts for statistics. She was an extremely fair and understanding prof, who tries to innovate her teaching style based on feedback.

Makes every new concept easy to understand, and goes through them very throughly. Weekly homework is not difficult, with weekly iClicker quizzes in person. Exams were spot on with what we learned in class, no surprises. Honestly there is nothing else you could want in a professor. Sonja is amazing, would recommend her for any statistics class.

Her explanations are clear and lectures are enjoyable. Midterm and Final questions were similar to the weekly assignments, which were straightforward and easy. Highly recommend it as an elective (Q/SS)! :))
So clear, organized, patient!
Really good prof! Slides were clear, and her lecturing was great. Would recommend

Professor Isberg is absolutely amazing. Most organized prof I've ever had. The material was already pretty easy, but she was so good at explaining it that it made the class even easier. This allowed me to get the first A+ of my university career! Overall, just an excellent experience and I'd definitely recommend her to everyone.

Professor Isberg is quite possibly the best professor I have had at SFU, and I am not even a stats major. I took this class as a Q credit without much thought, but it turned into one of my favourite courses this term. The lectures are well organized and helpful, and the professor leaves lots of time for questions. The exams are quite fair too.
best prof I've ever had. would highly recommend. she s super organized and cares about her students.
Great prof and person.

One of the best professors. Sonja is really caring and is exceptional at explaining concepts. Her exams are very fair provided you did the homework and quizzes and attended lectures. If you have the chance to take a course with her, do it!

A great prof and you can tell that she is passionate about what she teaches. Pretty much just goes over what was said in the textbook in lectures, but will answer any questions and gives clarification if needed.

Sonja really cares about her students and her lectures are very informative and clearly laid out. Takes the time to go over any questions a student may have during lecture and gives very detailed explanations to make sure no one is left behind. Would definitely recommend taking a class with her she is great at teaching!
Most organized prof ever. She is very caring and the course content was very easy. I would definitely recommend to take a class with her if you have the opportunity to do so.

He is really caring and his lectures are really done well. He adjusts the pace of the lectures to make sure everyone can keep up. People expect this course to be 0 work but you have to put in a little effort and you will do great. Very nice and helpful during office hours.

Easy GPA booster. If you just do the practice questions he assigns and read the material, this course should be easy for you. He is a great lecturer and I had a lot of fun in this course. All of the other people saying his tests were hard are thinking this course requires no work. Just study what he assigns and you will be fine.

I took stat100 with Phil, and he is a great prof. My only recommendation if you're taking a class with him is to study and practice the examples he goes over during lectures as that is what he tests you on rather than the textbook questions he assigns.

Still not done with his stat100 course but Phil is a fantastic lecturer and teacher. He is the best guy, takes every class nicely and slowly, and explains concepts clearly. He really cares for each student's success and does a lot to help us do well in his course. By far the best prof I have and I hope he continues to teach. 10/10 dude.

I took this course because it was listed as one of the easy breadth courses. But it seems to decrease my GPA instead. The course is very easy, but the prof has made it 10 times harder with difficult exams
Extremely hard tests. All I can say, don't take a class with him. More than half of the class has already dropped
His lectures are okay. But if you"re looking to boost your GPA, don't take it with him. His tests are really hard and often makes easy material extremely difficult than required.
Phil is nice but exams are very difficult. Often had to lower what the exam was out of because class did so poorly and average was too low
Easy course

I belive that Scot is crazy he wants to fail as many as he can. He know his material well but somehow he does not provide you with a clear and detail form.Midterm and final is not cover in the homework and course notes. He tries his best I know but he is not a normal professor. If you can take an other prof instead of him. 100 level expect 2 much
horrible...

I took this class for a breadth requirement and I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND. He seemed pretty nice but the lectures were so incredibly boring. It is all test based with two midterms and a final, all of which were difficult. He ended up curving significantly because of how poorly everyone performed.
He does care about his students and wants them to excel but his lectures are very boring and exams basically make up the entire class

Worst professor I've had. Horrible lectures, unclear + error filled + old version slides + topics explained with irrelevant analogies. Rambles forever, skips details and outright sections, and god it just gets worse. Exams: missing and incorrect data, grammar mistakes, and LONG questions. I HAD to take this course, but if you don't, STAY AWAY.

hes a good person and overall prof, but the course is only easy if you study really hard. he sometimes forget to release answers of homework questions before the exams. but he does explain what will roughly be on the exams a class before. this is definitely an examed based course.
I got a A+ in this class and I still think he teach really bad and explain things like he doesnt even know what to do. Overcome it, if you wanna get a high grade in his class, suffer yourself.

Awful lectures, awful slides, very tough grader, bad at explaining things concisely without rambling and getting off topic, forgets to upload proper slides and often teaches on updated versions we don't yet have access to. All this and he's condescending if you ask certain questions. Honestly cannot understand why he has such a good rating here.

Richard was a pretty nice prof. He made some errors in assignments but corrects them and owns up to his mistakes. Lectures aren't too interesting, he just sits back and explains/talks and sometimes rambles but I found this to be quite nice and kind of amusing. If you read and take notes on the textbook then you will breeze through this class.

Constantly had spelling or grammatical errors in tests/assignments, and it takes longer to figure out what he is asking than to actually formulate a response. TAs in this class were very biased markers as well. He does have cheat sheets which is a plus. Not too hard of a course in general but he makes it so much more unbearable. Don't recommend it

Had him for my first semester and it was difficult to sit through his lecture due to straight boredom. Richard definitely is well versed and knows what he's talking about tho. If you're reading this because someone told you it was a GPA booster, it really isn't. Only take this course if you HAVE TO. Don't be like me and get scammed.
The lectures are really boring, tests and quizzes are pretty simple. Just use the textbook for most part and cheat sheets are always allowed. Easy class but really boring.

Professor Lockhart is a nice guy with a clear passion for statistics. His lectures are a little more on the boring side, as he often goes on tangents about things that aren't too relevant to the topic. I am really, really bad at math but this class wasn't too difficult for me. Just remember to complete the online quizzes on time and you'll pass.

Stat100 is supposed to be a GPA booster. I gotta give him a decent rating because this course was exactly that. His grading scheme was quite generous & I didn't spend much time studying for the course. However, I would be wary to take him for a more difficult course since he rambles A LOT & tests on material we didn't cover.

Richard is a very engaging and passionate professor. I would say that his lectures are helpful and that you should go to them, but you also need to do independent notes using the textbook. The exams can be hard. He is looking for very specific wording of answers. Richard is easy to get in contact with and is very helpful with independent needs.

He doesn't explain anything from the textbook and his slides are pretty confusing since he only puts definitions in his slides. He barely taught any calculations needed for the tests. He doesn't elaborate on examples and the assignments have vague questions,.
He's a great prof but his exams are tough and require specific wording or you're wrong.

The final exam is way harder than the pervious midterms. Even though it is an open book exam, you can't actually find similar examples from the textbook or notes. But I can't blame on him because I skipped most of the lecture : He probably talked about some examples in the lecture.  Midterms are easy, just beware of the final and some assignments.

Richard seems to get lost in particular examples and goes off into tangents in lecture quite often. His midterms are definitely tricky and you need to be very careful about how you answer the questions. The TAs this semester could barely speak English, so questions on our assignments were marked wrong when in fact we worded the answers differently.

Statistics is one of those difficult classes, but this professor is very very clear. Unlike many other profs, he can teach! If you attend the class, pay attention and just stay consistent, expect a good grade!  Wish i went to class more i would have deffs gotten an A
He can''t figure out how to use the mic. HIs lecture are confusing. Seems like a pretty cool guy though.

I didn't know what he was asking for at times because of the confusing wording. For the most part I did okay, but that was until the final exam. Material from his notes was not really on the final exam.

Notes are a little unclear and accent is a bit of an obstacle, but he really cares about teaching the material and about explaining concepts in a relatable, understandable way. If you pay attention to his teaching, you'll learn a lot.

The class was pretty easy. Just watch his videos, study his notes, and you can do really well... I think he does prefer students to memorize his answers, but he will still give you the marks even if you don't- that is if you don't add in any words that change the meaning. Not the best prof out there, but certainly not the worst.

Probably the worst prof I've ever had in my 3 years at SFU. He's also the rudest prof I've ever had, and I can't believe that a university would actually hire someone like him. He is useless . Oh, and the final is worth 45% of your grade for a first year class. I have had bad profs, but they don't even hold a candle to this guy.

Good luck reading his notes. His english is so bad, that you honestly can't understand what he is trying to say. It's super confusing (especially if you're not a stats major) and he's honestly kind of a jerk. Avoid him like the plague.

Content is so easy but he's so arbitrary with his marking. He'll take so many marks off if you dont structure your sentence exactly like his. He was pretty funny early in the semester but he beats his jokes to death that he annoys the living fu ck out of you by the end of the semester.

He is awful. Not clear at all, and expects you to memorize his answers (bad grammar included). Oh, and apparently its totally okay for a prof to make fun of girls without makeup. Do yourself a favour and don't take a class with him.
Do not take class with him. Content is easy but is extremely hard marker. Long answer questions have to be answered word for word like in his examples, even if you show understanding of the question.

His lectures and papers are not worded very well. His class is basically watching his Youtube channel. Not much reason to attend. However the material is not too difficult, just read over the notes and you should be fine. Good luck!

He is not a good prof. I found him to be very rude and misogynistic . He does not lecture at all, he just plays youtube videos of himself lecturing. When you ask any questions, he often seems like he is talking down to you, and he really doesn't explain things well. I would avoid taking a stats class with him.
GREAT PROF! if you understand english, you understand him.. He's too nice, and too naive.. LEARN ENGLISH! You'll do very well!
never ever take this prof!!!!all i learn is just flipping a coin!
Alought he cannot make things clearly, but he is a really nice person. This STAT100 is a low average course. but if you read all the lectures, you will be fine. He is a kind person.

Boring... Rambles... Teaches "the theory behind statistics" so he doesn't allow numbers, formulas, calculators, etc... Extremely frustrating. Class average is in the 30s - bad. I mean, he's a nice guy, but this is not a good class.
the worst teacher ever!
brutal final compared to MTs. Super boring voice. no teaching ability. Knows the material but can't explain it on a 100 level. Forgets. Recommended for insomniacs.
very boring lec, fell asleep too many times... but all the stuff r in the notes
easy midterms, very hard final
No Comments
come on, he wasnt that bad! very detailed notes, tests based on notes,
He doesn't know how to teach.
don't even understand a word
aaaaargggggggggh

Becky is a great professor. Most of her exam questions come from the chapter practice questions. She gives many opportunities for bonus marks. However she does have quite a heavy accent so it may be hard to understand sometimes but she really cares about you

Dr Lin is a great professor. She allowed us to take a bonus quiz and earn an extra 1% just by opening a crowdmark account. Her accent may be tough to follow but her exams are easy. Also, this class has no homework, but 3 quizzes, 2 midterms and a final. Overall great class, would take again with Dr Lin.
Her STAT100 is very easy. 10/10 would recommend for B-Sci.

Provides lots of opportunities to gain bonus marks (but will not round due to so). Lectures are clear and directly related to assignments and exams. Overall she ensures that all students no matter there prior experience can do basic stats without causing too much confusion. Would STRONGLY recommend taking a course with her.
